TopicTitle: i need help on mode carrer

Articles.Content: I have a contract that I can not solve and is one that says put a probe in an equatorial orbit with reasonable deviation, the problem is that not indicate more things and do not understand what I should do

An equatorial orbit is just one that is lined up with the equator. So when you start turning during launch, you would want to point either east (90 degrees) or west (270 degrees), or simply "left and right." Hope I could help, and happy flying.

Also, this should go in the Gameplay Questions and Tutorials section, for future reference. A mod will come by shortly to move it, I'm sure.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-22T20:29:27Z" title="02/22/2015 08:29  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 22, 2015</time> by Lhathron the Elf**

dunno if tier 2 tracking station is needed, but

in mapview there should be a colored circle with moving dots that indicates the target orbit. the dots move in the direction your ship needs to be going. if clockwise launch to 270Ã‚Â° if anticlock 90Ã‚Â°. if you don't see the circle, zoom out more. sometimes they are pretty far out. 

pro tip: the tracking station shows the contract orbits before you accept them. check whether you can reach that orbit or rather not, especially with orbits around the sun!

another thing: do you use a probe? satellite missions need an unmanned craft which is launched after you accepted the contract(s).

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-22T21:33:23Z" title="02/22/2015 09:33  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 22, 2015</time> by MircoMars**

If it looks about right but it's not accepting it, you probably launched the wrong way. Watch the spinning lights on the target orbit.

 Best,

-Slashy
